intro: Desmoncus werdermannii, commonly known as the Werdermann's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellow-orange cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Desmoncus werdermannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
